info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 06 at 6:52PM EDT until July 06 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Chester County in Upstate South Carolina... Southeastern York County in Upstate South Carolina... East central Union County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 652 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Rock Hill to 8 miles northwest of Chester to 6 miles east of Union, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Chester, Monarch Mill, Mcconnells, Richburg, Lowrys, Chester State Park, Catawba, Leeds, Cornwell and Edgemoor. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
